tit.e: Genna Tsuho (Coin of the Genna Era)
tit.cmt: 統一事項に従ってタイトルに補足説明を加えました。
tit.e: Genna Tsuho (Coin of the Genna Era)

sen.j: 元和通宝（げんなつうほう）は、元和 (日本)元年（1615年）もしくは2年（1616年）頃に鋳造されたとされる、江戸時代の元号を用いた銅銭であり、寛永通宝以前のものである。
sen.e: Genna Tsuho is a copper coin named after an era in the Edo period, which is thought to have minted in approximately the first or second year of the Genna era in Japan (1615 or 1616), and it is older than Kanei Tsuho (coins).
sen.cmt: 元和元年もしくは2年→元号が関係するので旧暦も訳出しました。寛永通宝→ハイフンなしの訳語を使用しました。
sen.e: Genna Tsuho is a copper coin named after an era in the Edo period, which is thought to have been minted in around the first or second year of the Genna era (1615 or 1616) in Japan, and it is older than the Kanei Tsuho coin.
sen.cmt: ・approximatelyは概算値の場合に使われると思いますので、時期の場合はaroundが適切と思われます。・mintは他動詞なので受動態にしました。・括弧内の年代はGenna eraの後の方が分かりやすいので移動しました。・Kanei Tsuho (coins)とすると、Kanei Tsuho自体はcoinsという意味にとられるため、これが貨幣の名称であることがわかるように修正しました。
sen.e: Genna Tsuho is a copper coin named after an era in the Edo period, which is thought to have been minted in around the first or second year of the Genna era (1615 or 1616) in Japan, and it is older than the Kanei Tsuho coin.

sen.j: 銭文は「元和通寳」である。
sen.e: Senbun (letters engraved on coins) is '元和通寳' (Genna Tsuho).
sen.cmt: 「元和通寳」→日本語表記をそのまま使用し、括弧で読み方を補足しました。
sen.e: Senbun (letters engraved on coins) is '元和通寳' (Genna Tsuho).
Senbun (letters engraved on coins) is '元和通寳' (Genna Tsuho).

sen.j: この貨幣も慶長通宝と同様に正式な鋳造記録が確認されておらず、江戸幕府によるものであるか、民鋳の鐚銭であるのか、あるいはその発行目的など依然不明な銭貨である。
sen.e: Like Keicho Tsuho (coins), an official minting record of this currency has not been confirmed, and it is still unclear if it was issued by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) or it was privately minted Bitasen (low quality coins whose surfaces were worn away), as well as what the purpose of the issuance was, etc.
sen.cmt: 慶長通宝→ハイフンなしで訳しました。
sen.e: Like the Keicho Tsuho coin, an official minting record of this currency has not been confirmed, and there are some uncertainties such as whether it was issued by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), whether it was privately minted Bitasen (low quality coins whose surfaces were worn away), the purpose of the issuance, etc.
sen.cmt: ・if以降はas well aslを使うと意味がとりづらくなるため、there are some uncertainties such as の形にしました。・Keicho Tsuhoが単なるcoinsではなく、特定の貨幣であることが分かるようにしました。
sen.e: Like the Keicho Tsuho coin, an official minting record of this currency has not been confirmed, and there are some uncertainties such as whether it was issued by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), whether it was privately minted Bitasen (low quality coins whose surfaces were worn away), the purpose of the issuance, etc.

sen.j: 直径は0.8寸（2.4センチメートル）、量目（質量）は0.7匁（2.6グラム）前後であり、慶長通寳に近い。
sen.e: It is about 0.8 sun (2.4 cm) in diameter and 0.7 monme (2.6 g) in weight (mass), and is similar to Keicho Tsuho.
It is about 0.8 sun (2.4 cm) in diameter and 0.7 monme (2.6 g) in weight (mass), and is similar to Keicho Tsuho.
It is about 0.8 sun (2.4 cm) in diameter and 0.7 monme (2.6 g) in weight (mass), and is similar to Keicho Tsuho.

sen.j: 現存数は慶長通寳よりもさらに少なく、広く流通したとは考えられず試鋳貨幣にとどまった可能性も考えられる。
sen.e: As the number of the coins in existence are much smaller than that of Keicho Tsuho, it seems unlikely that these coins were largely used, and it is possible that they were minted just as trial coins.

As the number of the coins in existence are much smaller than that of Keicho Tsuho, it seems unlikely that these coins were widely distributed, and it is possible that they were minted just as trial coins.
sen.cmt: 「広く流通した」の意味が訳出されていませんでしたので、修正しました。
sen.e: As the number of the coins in existence are much smaller than that of Keicho Tsuho, it seems unlikely that these coins were widely distributed, and it is possible that they were minted just as trial coins.

sen.j: 銭文の変化による手代わりが存在し「大字」、「小字」および文字の太い「肥字」が知られる。
sen.e: There are some versions with differences in senbun, and daiji' (big letter), 'shoji" (small letter) and thick letter 'hiji' are known.
There are some versions with differences in senbun, and 'daiji' (big letter), 'shoji" (small letter) and 'hiji' (thick letter) are known.
sen.cmt: ・daijiの前のクォーテーションマークが抜けています。・hijiも他の項目と合わせて、括弧内に説明を入れました。
sen.e: There are some versions with differences in senbun, and 'daiji' (big letter), 'shoji' (small letter) and 'hiji' (thick letter) are known.

sen.j: 銅銭の他に、背に漢数字を鋳込んだ「番銭」と呼ばれる銀銭が存在し、これは水戸市の鋳造ともいわれる。
sen.e: Other than copper coins, there are silver coins called 'Bansen', which have Chinese characters to express numbers incused on the back, and they are said to have been minted by Mito City.
Other than copper coins, there are silver coins called 'Bansen,' which have Chinese characters to express numbers incused on the back, and they are said to have been minted by Mito City.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従って、コンマはクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。
sen.e: Other than copper coins, there are silver coins called 'Bansen,' which have Chinese characters to express numbers incused on the back, and they are said to have been minted by Mito City.
